content.prompt: Which of the following is the primary geographic effect of the globalization of the economy?

choices.label: Countries have greater control over economic activity within their borders.
More Local ownership makes industries less likely to move.
Production is increasingly concentrated in the Manufacturing Belt of the United States
Production is increasingly concentrated in the Rhine-Ruhr Valley of Europe.
Production is shifted to low-cost locations in developing countries.

unit.text: 7: Industrial and Economic Development Patterns and Processes

topic.text: 7.7: Changes as a Result of the World Economy

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe geographic concepts, processes, models, and theories.
